qas.question: What was the life span of Ibn Sina?
How many books were said to have been written by Ibn Sina?
What subjects did Ibn Sina mainly write about?
What medical book is Ibn Sina most noted for in European universities?
What philosophical encyclopedia is Ibn Sina known for writing?
What is defined as a philosopy influenced by Islam?
What philosophy is strictly produced by Muslims?
What scholar lived from the 9th to the 10th century?
What book was used in Universities around the world?
Where was The Book of Healing the standard test?

context: One of the common definitions for <b5_0>"Islamic philosophy"<b5_0/> is "the style of philosophy produced within the framework of Islamic culture." <b6_0>Islamic philosophy<b6_0/>, in this definition is neither necessarily concerned with religious issues, nor is exclusively produced by Muslims. The Persian scholar <b7_0>Ibn Sina<b7_0/> (Avicenna) (<a0_0>980–1037<a0_0/>) had more than <a1_0>450<a1_0/> books attributed to him. His writings were concerned with various subjects, most notably <a2_0>philosophy and medicine<a2_0/>. His medical textbook <a3_0><b8_0>The Canon of Medicine<b8_0/><a3_0/> was used as the standard text in <b9_0>European universities<b9_0/> for centuries. He also wrote <a4_0>The Book of Healing<a4_0/>, an influential scientific and philosophical encyclopedia.
